block.p: Pamela Marie Fleming and Peter Claver Horan were married yesterday by Tristram King, a nondenominational minister, at Mirassou Champagne Cellars in Los Gatos, Calif.

The bride, 37, is a vice president for marketing at Women.com, a Web site based in San Mateo, Calif. She graduated from Boston College. She is the daughter of Susan Fleming of Portland, Ore., and Dr. Richard Fleming of Wilton, Conn. Her father retired as the chief of radiology at Stamford Hospital in Connecticut.
Pamela Marie Fleming and Peter Claver Horan were married yesterday by Tristram King, a nondenominational minister, at Mirassou Champagne Cellars in Los Gatos, Calif.

The bride, 37, is a vice president for marketing at Women.com, a Web site based in San Mateo, Calif. She graduated from Boston College. She is the daughter of Susan Fleming of Portland, Ore., and Dr. Richard Fleming of Wilton, Conn. Her father retired as the chief of radiology at Stamford Hospital in Connecticut.

The bridegroom, 45, is the chief executive of DevX Inc., a company in Palo Alto, Calif., that provides technical information to corporate software developers. He graduated from Santa Clara University and received a M.B.A. from San Francisco State College. He is a son of Marilyn and Daniel Horan of Oxnard, Calif. His father is the vice president for sales at Broadband TelCom Power Inc., a manufacturer of electronics supplies in Santa Ana, Calif.
The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
